page.title: 08 AYNHOE PARK HOUSE
page.content: Aynhoe Park House is owned by the Mutual Household Association and is used as flats. It used to be owned by the Cartwright family until the late 1950s. It is the biggest building in Aynho and dominates the village. It is built in the classical style and consists of 3 wings around a central courtyard. It is built out of stone. To the south there was a large {DEER PARK} but this has now been turned over to agriculture. Separating the house from the park is a sunken ditch known as a ha-ha. In the grounds is a well preserved {ICE HOUSE}. This is a brick lined pit in the ground where ice from the canal was stored during the summer.
